pages.title: ⤝ Five of Swords ⤝
pages.text: Spirit of Defeat$(br)    ♀ Venus in ♒ Aquarius

A person looks on in disdain over their shoulder.$(br)  Four swords levitate in formation in the air; and a fifth sword is in their right hand, point to the earth.$(br)  They are the oppressive master in possession of the battlefield, while two figures retreat in humiliation.$(br)  After a conflict we can readily see its consequences taking their toll, even if one comes out the apparent victor, they soon realize that they have lost as much as (or more

than) their opponents.$(br)  The price of contention is loss of trust, respect, dignity, and often company.$(br)  As they try to pick up the pieces and set the conflict behind them, they find it's more difficult than they thought; others have lost faith in them and are already keeping their distance.$(br)  The longer they brood, or the more force they spent trying to prove themselves, the more challenging will be the resolution.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Destruction, infamy, dishonour, overconfidence.$(br)  Followed by defeat, shame, depression, silence.$(br)  A harsh situation where people cannot communicate.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Speaking up, defending yourself. Refusal to accept defeat.$(br)  A call for a harmonious clarification.
